org.nlpcraft.model.intent

Interface NCIntentSolverContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface NCIntentSolverContext
extends Serializable
    A context that is passed into callback of the matched intent.
    See Also:
    NCIntentSolver.IntentCallback, NCIntentSolver.addIntent(NCIntentSolver.INTENT, NCIntentSolver.IntentCallback)

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getIntentId

        String getIntentId()
        Gets ID of the matched intent.
        Returns:
        ID of the matched intent.

      • getQueryContext

        NCQueryContext getQueryContext()
        Query context from the original NCModel.query(NCQueryContext) method.
        Returns:
        Original query context.

      • getIntentTokens

        List<List<NCToken>> getIntentTokens()
        Gets a subset of tokens representing matched intent. This subset is grouped by the matched terms where null sub-list defines an optional term. Order and index of sub-lists corresponds to the order and index of terms in the matching intent. Note that unlike getVariant() method this method returns only subset of the tokens that were part of the matched intent. Specifically, it will not return tokens for free words, stopwords or unmatched ("dangling") tokens.
        Returns:
        List of list of tokens representing matched intent.
        See Also:
        getVariant()

      • getVariant

        NCVariant getVariant()
        Gets sentence variant that produced the matching for this intent.
        Returns:
        Sentence variant that produced the matching for this intent.
        See Also:
        getIntentTokens()

      • isExactMatch

        boolean isExactMatch()
        Indicates whether or not the intent match was exact.

        An exact match means that for the intent to match it has to use all non-free word tokens in the user input, i.e. only free word tokens can be left after the match. Non-exact match doesn't have this restriction. Note that non-exact match should be used with a great care. Non-exact match completely ignores extra found user or system tokens (which are not part of the intent template) which could have altered the matching outcome had they been included.

        Intent callbacks can check this property and provide custom rejection message.
        Returns:
        True if the intent match was exact, false otherwise.
